abstract: A deal between Sanofi-Aventis, France’s largest drug company, and Bristol-Myers Squibb of the United States could still be in the offing. The Times of London reports that if a battle of egos between Sanofi’s chairman and its younger chief executive is resolved, the French company may dust off its $54 billion merger plans with Bristol-Myers.
lead_paragraph: A deal between Sanofi-Aventis, France’s largest drug company, and Bristol-Myers Squibb of the United States could still be in the offing. The Times of London reports that if a battle of egos between Sanofi’s chairman and its younger chief executive is resolved, the French company may dust off its $54 billion merger plans with Bristol-Myers.

headline.main: Sanofi Executives Said to Clash on Bristol-Myers Bid
